baseline_groups.claim_summary: Season interruption (syntheticT) increases probability of marrying commoner (cOut)
baseline_groups.notes: Coef=0.0043, p=0.052. Borderline significant. N varies by specification.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Season interruption reduces probability of marrying an heir
Season interruption increases absolute mismatch in landholdings
Season interruption reduces signed mismatch (husband lower landholdings)
Season interruption increases probability of marrying down

global_notes: Historical study of the London Season (elite marriage market) disruption 1861-63. Primary outcome (married commoner) is borderline significant at 5%. Sorting outcomes (landholding mismatch, marrying down) are more clearly significant. 66 specs total. IV first-stage F=8.4 (weak instrument concern).
